definitions.definition: Greatly diminished size or form; reduced scale.
A small version of something; a model of reduced scale.
definitions.example: There was a miniature of a whaling ship in a glass bottle over the mantlepiece.

definitions.definition: A small, highly detailed painting, a portrait miniature.
The art of painting such highly detailed miniature works.
An illustration in an illuminated manuscript.
A musical composition which is short in duration.
definitions.example: Sacha composed a miniature for strings as a final project at the conservatory.

definitions.definition: A chess game which is concluded with very few moves.
A token in a game representing a unit or character.
definitions.example: Jack had dozens of miniatures of Napoleonic footsoldiers painted in detailed period regalia for his wargames.

definitions.definition: To make smaller than normal; to reproduce in miniature.

definitions.example: I find miniature dogs annoying; they seem to yap more than full-size dogs.
